definitions.text: cut down on; make a reduction in
examples: The employer wants to cut back health benefits

definitions.text: make less complex
examples: reduce a problem to a single question

definitions.text: bring to humbler or weaker state or condition
examples: He reduced the population to slavery

definitions.text: simplify the form of a mathematical equation of expression by substituting one term for another
lower in grade or rank or force somebody into an undignified situation
examples: She reduced her niece to a servant

definitions.text: be the essential element
examples: The proposal boils down to a compromise

definitions.text: reduce in size; reduce physically
examples: Hot water will shrink the sweater

definitions.text: lessen and make more modest
make smaller
to remove oxygen from a compound, or cause to react with hydrogen or form a hydride, or to undergo an increase in the number of electrons
narrow or limit
put down by force or intimidation
examples: The government quashes any attempt of an uprising
China keeps down her dissidents very efficiently
The rich landowners subjugated the peasants working the land

definitions.text: undergo meiosis
reposition (a broken bone after surgery) back to its normal site
destress and thus weaken a sound when pronouncing it
reduce in scope while retaining essential elements
be cooked until very little liquid is left
examples: The sauce should reduce to one cup

definitions.text: cook until very little liquid is left
examples: The cook reduced the sauce by boiling it for a long time

definitions.text: lessen the strength or flavor of a solution or mixture
take off weight
